legal_basis: sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
decision_reasoning: adequate state protection available in Mexico
cause_of_action: fearing retaliation from a drug trafficker after refusing involvement in criminal activities
procedure_followed: judicial review application filed challenging RPD's rejection of refugee claims based on sections 96 and 97
result_of_case: Federal Court upheld RPD's decision, dismissing the application for judicial review
risk_of_persecution: refusal to participate in drug trafficking
state_protection: adequate state protection available in Mexico
standard_of_review: reasonable and within the range of acceptable outcomes
decision_made: dismissed the application for judicial review
evidence_presented: Applicants claimed persecution due to refusal to participate in drug trafficking
